body.p: The appendices element available in bookmap has a special behavior (based on its sibling nodes):

ol.li: If the bookmap contains part elements, the appendices will behave as a part
If the bookmap contains chapter (and no part), the appendices will behave as a chapter

body.note: Behavior includes page-break, numbering and title rendering.
body.p: For example, if I define a bookmap with part, I will obtain:<part> <chapter/> <topicref/> <chapter/> </part> <appendices> <!-- Appendices behaves like a Part --> <appendix/> <!-- Appendix behaves like a Chapter --> <appendix/> </appendices>

Another example, if I define a bookmap with chapter only, I will obtain:<chapter/> <topicref/> <chapter/> <appendices> <!-- Appendices behaves like a Chapter --> <appendix/> <!-- Appendix behaves like a TopicRef --> <appendix/> </appendices>
body.note: If the appendices element is not defined and the appendix is used directly instead, then it will behave like Part or Chapter using the same pattern as for appendices.
